name: Agentic AI
description: Autonomous AI systems that can independently plan, decide, and act to achieve goals. Agents would handle complex multi-step workflows across enterprise functions.
accuracyNote: Too early to score — agentic AI is the hottest trend in tech. Major investment from all players, but practical autonomous agents are still being figured out.

name: AI Governance Platforms
description: Comprehensive platforms for managing AI risk, ensuring compliance with regulations (EU AI Act), monitoring model behavior, and maintaining audit trails.
accuracyNote: Too early to score — EU AI Act enforcement drives demand. AI governance is becoming a must-have, not a nice-to-have.

name: Disinformation Security
description: Advanced tools and frameworks to combat AI-generated disinformation at scale, including deepfake detection, content authentication, and provenance tracking.
accuracyNote: Too early to score — deepfakes and synthetic media are a growing threat. Detection and provenance tools are evolving rapidly.

name: Postquantum Cryptography
description: Migration to quantum-resistant encryption algorithms as quantum computing advances threaten current cryptographic standards.
accuracyNote: Too early to score — NIST standards published, migration starting slowly. 'Harvest now, decrypt later' attacks drive urgency.

name: Ambient Invisible Intelligence
description: Pervasive, low-cost sensing and intelligence embedded in environments through smart tags, sensors, and edge AI processing.
accuracyNote: Too early to score — concept is compelling but practical deployment at scale hasn't happened yet.

name: Energy-Efficient Computing
description: Technologies and architectures to dramatically reduce the energy consumption of AI training and inference, including new chip designs and optimized algorithms.
accuracyNote: Too early to score — AI's energy demands make this critical. Focus on inference efficiency, model compression, and green data centers.

name: Hybrid Computing
description: Unified computing environments spanning classical, quantum, edge, and specialized AI hardware, orchestrated as a single compute fabric.
accuracyNote: Too early to score — cloud/edge hybrid is real, but quantum integration remains experimental.

name: Spatial Computing
description: Computing experiences that blend digital content with the physical world through AR, VR, and mixed reality, enabled by advancing hardware and AI.
accuracyNote: Too early to score — Apple Vision Pro and Meta Quest exist but mainstream adoption unclear. Needs a compelling use case beyond gaming.

name: Polyfunctional Robots
description: Versatile, AI-powered robots that can learn new tasks, adapt to different environments, and work alongside humans in various settings.
accuracyNote: Too early to score — humanoid robotics is attracting massive investment but practical deployment is limited to demos and controlled environments.

name: Neurological Enhancement
description: Brain-computer interfaces and neurotechnology that can read, interpret, and potentially augment neural activity for medical and cognitive applications.
accuracyNote: Too early to score — Neuralink making progress on medical applications, but consumer cognitive enhancement is science fiction for now.
